fields.description:
While testing out the [AutoScaling+CloudWatch+Jenkins Swarm wiki entry|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/wiki/Autoscaling-your-Jenkins-fleet-with-CW-AS-Swarm],  an AutoScaling instance was launched from a CloudWatch alarm being triggered.  It went into a _running_ state, but it did not obtain a public IP:

{code}
[hspencer@odc-d-06-07 ~]$ euca-describe-instances

TAG	instance	i-9C2344ED	aws:autoscaling:groupName	JenkinsScalingGroup
TAG	instance	i-9C2344ED	euca:node	node1

TAG	instance	i-31AF3FE2	euca:node	node1

$ euwatch-describe-alarms --show-long

fields.summary: AutoScaling Instance in Running State without Public IP
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* 1 x CLC, Walrus
* 1 x CC, SC
* 1 x NC

comments.body: This is actually pretty consistent now.  I even removed the CloudWatch alarm, Autoscaling policy and group.  It seems that its the first instance triggered from the alarm.  After that, all other instances are assigned public IPs.

To try and find a workaround, I did the following:

* Remove the CloudWatch metric alarm
* Set the AutoScaling Group to 0 capacity
* Did a restart of the eucalyptus-cloud process (CLC, Walrus)
* Waited till all services were _ENABLED_
* Updated the AutoScaling group back to the original setting
* Reapplied the CloudWatch metric alarm

The error still presented itself.
Was able to confirm behavior multiple times; even after restarting eucalyptus-cloud process on CLC, Walrus machine.
[~kedwards], can we get this on the radar quickly?
Attaching sosreport with DB dump, additional eucalyptus log files, and other eucalyptus specific information.
I'm not able to reproduce this issue, please provide a description of the steps to reproduce.
I have not been able to reproduce this issue, but it looks like a general addressing issue rather than anything auto scaling specific.
Stopping investigation so that it hits Engineering bug scrub
[~hspencer], I'm trying to reproduce this issue currently, let me know if you are able to reproduce this on another system.
This issue is a duplicate of EUCA-7163.
